39352629.review:
If you want to chill with a simple game this is the right choice. 

The controls are good and precise, you can set your own checkpoint to be less frustrated of doing the entire level because of a small mistake and you can even decide to have a more challenging way to play with the limited live and speedrun modes.

PS: the musics are also good to hear when concentrating on a specific jump.

39168041.review:
Kuso é um jogo lançado para PC em novembro de 2017, pelo desenvolvedor conhecido como Fred Wood. O jogo é uma sequência do game chamado "Love", que assim como este jogo, se trata de um jogo indie de puzzle lembrando bastante alguns jogos clássicos do Atari.

Kuso é um jogo definitivamente MUITO simples. A gameplay de fundo já está resumindo muito do que o jogo é. Aqui, basicamente você é um pequeno personagem que tem que atravessar por diversos desafios, que claro, vão sempre se dificultando cada vez mais. Enquanto atravessa as diversar plataformas, você tem a habilidade de correr, pular e até mesmo criar um checkpoint para salvar o jogo no momento em que achar mais interessante.

Ideal para aqueles que gostam de jogos curtos, ou que gostam de jogar algo enquanto estão baixando um jogo ou coisa do tipo, em Kuso você pode chegar a concluir o jogo em até um pouco mais de uma hora, dependendo bastante do quão rápido e preciso você consegue ser. Após zerar, você também terá vários outros modos mais complexos, com limite de tempo ou vidas.

Com um level design bastante bem desenhado, o jogo se torna interessante para os fãs de jogos de plataforma que querem algo desafiante e rápido. Sem dúvidas, vale a pena, principalmente se o jogo estiver com desconto.

38900854.review:
Kuso is exactly what I expected, a platformer in a very retro pixelated style with a challenging (but not impossible) difficulty. The balance is perfect and the entire game is extremely well-paced. If you're one that likes to "casually" avoid traps, this game is certainly one you should put on your "I-still-want-to-play-this-game"-list.

38656279.review:
「これはkusoですか」「はいkusoです」
「これはクソですか」「とんでもない！素晴らしいゲームですよ」

タイトルとは反してとても良い出来の死にゲー
このゲームの特徴として、自由にいくらでも自分でチェックポイントを設置できる
そのため難しい所を超えたけどチェックポイントがないなんてこともなく、しっかりとセーブ出来る足場が用意されている
操作性は良く、当たり判定も見た目通りでストレスを感じない
リトライまでが非常に短く死んだのに気づいたころには復活している
死に方も複数あり、こだわりを感じる
BGMは非常に良い上に全ステージ別のBGMが用意されている
やりこみ要素として実績とスピードランモードが用意されている
ついでにシークレット要素まで用意されていて非の打ち所がない
数ある死にゲーの中でも素晴らしい出来をしているので是非プレイして欲しい

38647736.review:
[h1]If you played LOVE:[/h1]
[b]Kuso is an improvement to its prequel Love in almost every sense of the word.[/b] Most notable are the die-able checkpoints, improved rating system and new passages where multiple objects combine to form more difficult pathways. The new engine is more robust and kuso contains a lot of cool new level elements and improved level design. The increase in difficulty is definitively one of its stronger points, effectively doubling playtime. On the flipside, imo, there is a perceived loss of charm and expression of creativity. The varying level-of-detail, such as the crocodile mouth, the ending of level 8 and the cute soundtrack in level 9, and little dragons at the end gave the game a retro-active vibe thats almost entirely lost in its sequel. Everybody praises the game for its soundtrack, and although its great, its not all that fitting at times. Nevertheless, if LOVE was your thing, youll probably love this game too!

[h1]For newcomers:[/h1]
[b]Kuso is a simplistic, challenging-to-difficult platformer with a keen eye for level design.[/b] The game naturally lends itself for speedrunning and although you'll finish the game in about 40m first time through, you'll probably be coming back to get that double A rating down (hard!). The challenge is found mostly in its passages where multiple objects have to be tracked, and maneuvering through moving objects where absolute jump precision is required to succeed. The jumping mechanic is time sensitive and the level design is really well-adjusted to this. The game offers multiple modes with limited lives and some secrets to increase playtime. Although the level design is really solid, some 'bullet-hell' like sections were a little frustrating. They were way too difficult for me so i ended up just randomly jumping my way though hoping id succeed. If the trailer feels inviting, the price is right!

38646583.review: Mmmm this game is fun but the soundtrack.... the soundtrack is incredible

37614872.review: DAMN this game is good, its hard, and the soundtrack is great.

37537938.review:
I appreciate KUSO very much.
I appreciate how it lets you just play the game how you'd like. KUSO is very hard, but it goes out of its way to be fair. You can create your own checkpoints, and you can make as many of them as you'd like. You can also fail as many times as you'd like, there is no limit. But then there are modes that DO limit your lives and checkpoints, if you feel like challenging yourself.
I really enjoy the way KUSO looks, though I do wish the environments had a bit more variety to them. Even with faux-retro graphics, you can tell a story purely by showing the world change a little bit as the game progresses. The last level of KUSO looks a lot like the previous levels, which also looks a lot like the developer's previous game, LOVE. It's not a bad look! But I hope he stretches his legs a bit in future titles.

36976180.review: Excellent jeu qui demande beaucoup d'adresse.

36879382.review:
Fluid, consistent controls. Well thought-out level design.
I almost cried on the final level. 
Great game, gorgeous soundtrack.

36873768.review:
Si LOVE te gustó, este te va a encantar.
Mejorado en muchos aspectos, mejor control, mejores obstáculos, mejor música.

36613268.review:
kuso keeps it weird, but loses a little of its prequel's quirky charm by being more of a consistent experience.  Still, it's a phenomenal platformer with a great soundtrack, an excrutiatingly fun risk vs. reward system in self-checkpoints, and exciting puzzle elements.  Also features fewer leaps of faith then its predecessor.

The developer has paid enormous attention to the clean level design and players first, and it pays off big.  Even the menus are a pleasure to navigate.  A well-deserved win.

36581431.review:
Well, Kuso is a Hard platformer game.

There is times when you are going to die, die, die and die more, but dont worry, if this is your first time in this type of games or dont usually play this type, there is a game mode called "Unlimited", where you have an unlimited number of lives, which is good to practice, and recommended for your first time in my opinion.

The design is simple but good, it kinda reminded me of a game i played years ago when i was a kid. 
The gameplay is addictive, you will spend some good hours of rage on this game, but totally worth it!

The price i would say its fair for the game, good design, execelent soundtrack and good price, cant ask for more.
Totally recomended!

36557120.review:
I liked the game even though I died 900 times on the first playthrough (note that the only platformer I played before is Mario). But even though I died so much it didn't feel too bad, because you can make yourself some checkpoints. The game costs 4.99 and that might scare you off, because if it is so cheap it should be horrible, but it isn't. I think 4.99 is a fair price, the game is good but not too long.

I really liked the music, which was fitting to every level and sometimes even to every jump you make. The artstyle looks simplistic but it works well for the game. Because of the artstyle the game is pretty small, so even if you have a potato computer, you can run this game.

36453044.review:
I don't really write reviews on games, but I figured I'd give credit where it's due for this smaller title.  Firstly, I bought this game mostly for the sound track after seeing it briefly played on stream and seeing that there is a bundle for a marginal cost that includes the sound track.  

That said, I gave the game a try and it's a total blast.  It's a very smooth old school platformer that let's you take on as much challenge as you desire.  On my first playthrough I died 400 times but the smooth tunes and the checkpoint system kept me from getting frustrated, as I tend to get on difficult platformers.  Next I tried Arcade mode which limits you to 125 lives; I tried this on my second playthrough and finish with a scant 8 lives.  The "hard" setting only gives you 10 lives, so good luck with that! In order to practice, it also allows you to pick any of the levels and just run through them to your heart's content.   

In short, really well put together.  As tough as you want it to be.  Excellent sound track.

36436687.review: This game deserves way more love (heh) than it's getting. The art, level design, animation, and music are all phenomenal, and it all flows together to make something greater than the sum of it's parts. I'm honestly having trouble finding anything bad to say about it.

36435190.review: This is an amazing game, The level design is really hard and amazing good, It is VVVVVV all over again. Having saving ability at any point is very good idea, it makes the game more accessible to people how love these type of games but not really good at them.

36429618.review:
stumbled across this on twitter, bought instantly, no regrets at all!

This game offers a doable and enjoyable challenge for people who like platformers and a fun game to study, deconstruct and master for people who like speedrunning.

The stand-out feature is probably that you can set your own safepoints, which is a nice little addition to a good core game.

The music is great (i think each level has a different piece) and makes, together with the simple but polish art and animation, kuso a game that I will gladly recommend to my friends.

36429120.review: Excellent and challenging. awesome music/sound too. Bargain. My son and I are enjoying this one.

36428056.review: A well-crafted platformer. The kind that gives me a good feeling of "just one more level." I think it has a gorgeous aesthetic and an immersive soundtrack!

36421586.review:
[h1]kuso – вторая игра от разработчика LOVE Фреда Вуда [/h1]

Фред Вуд анонсировал  kuso ещё 15 января 2017 года и вот, спустя 296 дней игра вышла в релиз 7 ноября 2017 года. Цена на данную игру составляет 2.99$ в странах СНГ и 130 рублей на территории России.

[list]

[*] Давненько мы не видели хорошо проработанный, сбалансированный платформер. Предшественница kuso была тоже хороша, но в kuso разработчик всё довёл до ума и теперь в это действительно приятно играть. 
Всего в игре около двадцати уровней и они обычно не больше одного экрана. У меня первое прохождение заняло 50 минут с 800 смертями, 2048 прыжками и около 500 чекпоинтов. Не долго, но это компенсируется несколькими режимами прохождениями: Безлимитный, в котором бесконечно жизней; казуальный, в котором вы сможете умереть 120 раз; режим спидраннера, который даст вам счётчик и бесконечно жизней.
Впрочем это всё что можно сказать об игре. Она весёлая, подойдёт для стрима, для нескольких прохождений, для спидрана. Не более.

[/list]

Вердикт:[i] короткий, удобный, честный платформер. Игра подойдёт всем любителям попрыгать.[/i]

Оценка: [b]7/10[/b]. Твёрдое похвально.

Обзор был составлен Ci8, главным куратором в [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bigbadwhl] BigBadWhale Games[/url], куратором в [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Obzor4ik]«Обзоры онлайн»[/url] в сотрудничестве с [url=http://welovebundles.ru/]WeLoveBundles[/url] 

Ключ к игре предоставил издатель, но это [u]никак не влияет[/u] на моё мнение и оценку.

Оценка редакции:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=706582524

36408484.review: Fun little platformer. Hard as heck, but the infinite checkpoint drop mechanic turns jumps into mini-puzzles. It's a good time.

36395247.review:
Finally the sequel of LOVE has arrived! LOVE was one very good charming ol' miniature platformer, now it becomes a harder challenge, with new and more levels than the original, packed with so many artstyles and fresh and unique design.

Pros:
+Charming pixel art
+Miniature platformer
+Good aesthetic
+25 Levels of pure heaven
+Respawn with a portable checkpoint (By pressing 'X' everytime you want a checkpoint)

Cons:
-The game didn't have the remastered levels of the "LOVE" in the full release which is a shame

Verdict: 9/10
Satisfied right now! This is better than the first game (no doubt). It has more levels and the framerate is better.

36385425.review:
This is a very fun game, just like LOVE was. It was an instant buy for me. I beat the "unlimited" difficulty in 76 minutes (489 deaths).

I do want to mention that you cannot save your game, so you must beat it in one sitting.

36353756.review: a must buy if you're a fan of platformers and/or speedrunning. a little on the short side if you only want to play it once (seasoned platformer fans can easily complete the game once in under an hour) but the replay value is top notch if you enjoy secret hunting and score chasing. also, the music is absolutely phenomenal.

36353547.review:
Fred Wood's preceding game LOVE has a sort of special significance for me. I was introduced to it through a let's player/streamer I used to watch waaaaaaay back in probably 2010 or maybe even earlier than that. It was one of the first few indie games I have had exposure to during those times when I didn't really know the internet all that well. I fell in love with it instantly. Crushing difficulty, smooth tunes and a sleek lofi aesthetic. It was an is a solid game that sets out what it wanted to achieve.

Every so often my mind drifts back to LOVE and eventually that led to me discovering the existence of this game, kuso. So I was pretty excited of the idea of playing some more in the style of LOVE. And sure enough it doesn't disappoint. It's a difficult platformer with fantastic music, tight controls, and is basically everything I would have wanted from a sequel to LOVE. The soundtrack is a must purchase for the asking price of 2.99 for 26 tracks! I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes challenging platformers.

36352129.review:
kuso, contrary to it's name, is not a kuso game. But as intended, it will probably make you curse under your breath as you try to complete the game in anything other than the unlimited-checkpoint mode.

This game is hard, but it's the right kind of difficulty - fair and telegraphed. It's a precision platformer with simple and intuitive controls - you just run and jump, and time your movement over many different obstacles. It's a relatively short game, but it is longer and more difficult than its predecessor, Love, which is the game that made me excited to get kuso in the first place.

The music is good: like seriously, this lo-fi track https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_kh42huPe78 featured in the trailer for the first game is excellent and really helped me get interested in buying the game, and after knowing that the soundtrack held up throughout all the levels, I knew it would be a great feature of kuso as well. The music really supplements the experience of playing these games, with their flat black backgrounds but detailed pixelated art, and difficult platforming gameplay that both scare you into making a mistake or put you into a sort of zen state as you concentrate through playing carefully.

I just really appreciate the design of these types of games: simple and self-contained with fluid controls, difficult enough to be engaging but forgiving enough and with enough difficulty options so as not to overwhelm the player, and it's like.... the game is really a work of art. WIth a game like this that doesn't have story or too many human-world elements, there's a focus on becoming immersed in the game's style, music, and gameplay, and that's what makes it feel like a real piece of art.

I don't often write reviews, but I'm writing one because I feel that simple, well-designed games like this deserve more recognition. Anyways, hope you guys enjoy the game and have a nice day!

36350912.review:
I was not familiar with 'Love' so coming into Kuso, I wasn't sure what to expect.

I began my playthrough on the Unlimited mode, which was recommended for new players, and made it through the base game in ~44 minutes. I thoroughly enjoyed every minute, even if I did get frustrated from time to time -- but isn't that the point of games like this?

I do plan on going back in and attempting the other modes -- one giving you 125 lives (I died roughly 200+ times) and one that gives you 10 -- which seems INSANE. 

I highly recommend this game. And before I hit submit, I just want to commend the dev for a great game and also an amazing soundtrack. I love every song included throughout. Easily one of the best soundtracks I have heard in 2017.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=96z5bIDqmNs

36349054.review: A better sequel to Love couldn't have been made. It takes everything good about Love and makes it great, and throws away everything that was bad. The overall aesthetic to Love was a bit better,  what with the whole factory vibe, but honestly that's my only gripe. Oh and the soundtrack is fucking phenomenal. Can't wait 'til the Collectors Editon comes out so I can listen to that shit for hours on end.

36348931.review: A very well crafted game with a brilliant soundtrack! A real challenge but worth it.. The best new platformer I've played in a while!

36346535.review: At its core this is a straightforward precision platformer without fluff (story, characters, cutscenes). In addition comes the teletext-like graphics and great electronic music creating a sort of meditative pixel art. Beating the game is a moderate challange - the real beauty comes from how it invites itself to be speedrun. Even if I never make it to serous leaderboards, repeating the levels and finding the right strats is somehow strangely relaxing. 'Love' was a fantastic game and this is an improvement on it in every way.

36344912.review:
If you've played LOVE before, then you should really try this game. kuso has a lot of different places from LOVE. 

Most obvious changes include: 
a. Your respawn could be "killed" now, so you could no longer pass the level by keeping pressing S. (Though I think it is a kind of the gameplay...) 
b. You cannot jump on the booster now. Oh no. 
c. The whole game seems more "fluent" than LOVE... you know, this game boasts a "futuristic", but not "classic" style.
d. We have 25 levels now! Though they are not so unique between each other (which is different from LOVE, playing LOVE is like seeking a fantastic world), you can still enjoy jumping and timing.

First try with "Easy mode" cost me 57 mins, and I died 901 times... (you can even watch 901 little guys falling into the trap one after another when you complete all levels, XD) Anyway, just download it and enjoy a whole new trip!

36344095.review:
Another fantastic game from the brain (and notebook) of Fred Wood! I've been following this for a while after loving his previous game, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/269270/LOVE/]LOVE[/url].
The platforming control is fantastic once again, and there is a cool grading system at the end of the game that reminds you how many times you died throughout.
And to top it all off, the soundtrack, once again by James Bennett is superb and complements the gameplay very well.

This is a great game whether you played and enjoyed LOVE as I did, or entered into the series through this game.
